qas.question: Commentated broadcasts of all England matches air on what network?
What was the first season in which England's qualifiers and friendlies were broadcast on ITV?
What network is ITV's affiliate in northern and central Scotland?
In what year was an England football match aired only via the internet for the first time?
Approximately how many total viewers watched the England World Cup qualifier on the internet on 10 October 2009?
In what year did BBC Radio 5 Live start broadcasting England's matches?
How many people listen to BBC Radio 5 Live broadcasts of England's matches during the 2008-09 season?
In what year was Setanta Sports founded?
Who did England play against on 10 October 2009?

context: All <b6_0>England<b6_0/> matches are broadcast with full commentary on <a0_0>BBC Radio 5 Live<a0_0/>. From the <a1_0><b5_0>2008<b5_0/>–09<a1_0/> season until the 2017–18 season, England's home and away qualifiers, and friendlies both home and away are broadcast live on ITV (often with the exception of <a2_0>STV<a2_0/>, the ITV affiliate in central and northern Scotland). England's away qualifiers for the 2010 World Cup were shown on Setanta Sports until that company's collapse. As a result of Setanta Sports's demise, England's World Cup qualifier in <b9_0>Ukraine<b9_0/> on 10 October <a3_0><b8_0>2009<b8_0/><a3_0/> was shown in the United Kingdom on a pay-per-view basis via the internet only. This one-off event was the first time an England game had been screened in such a way. The number of subscribers, paying between £4.99 and £11.99 each, was estimated at between <b7_0>250,000<b7_0/> and 300,000 and the total number of viewers at around <a4_0>500,000<a4_0/>.
